result.execSummary:
John Michael Rea was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means John Michael Rea was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Michael Rea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant John Michael Rea in court with attorney Scott H Southworth.  Linda A Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Southworth addresses the Court.  State responds.  Court addresses issues.  Court wants to get date for possible hearing on habeas corpus.  Court orders DE be turned over to the jail today by court security on the Governor's warrant.  Court sets over to the end of the calendar for today.  Back on the record, Court notes he is without ability to consider setting bail and therefore will not hear motion to modify existing bond.  Atty Southworth states his position now re: writ of habeas corpus.  Notes all parties have been notified of the current status, including the people in Kansas.  State has nothing to add.  Court questions DE on waiver of further proceedings.  DE is in agreement.  Court accepts and DE will be taken to Sauk County jail now pending pick up by the State of Kansas.

Defendant John Michael Rea in court with attorney Scott H Southworth.  Linda A Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Court notes he's read the motion re: bond modification.  State is objecting and explains what exactly they are objecting to and notes the Governor's warrant has now come through.  Atty Southworth responds.  State responds that DE now needs to be taken into custody and taken back to Kansas so that makes the motion unnecessary.  Atty Southworth responds.  Court addresses possibly finishing this later this afternoon.  Court takes recess.  Back on the record, Court addresses setting this to 2:15 this afternoon.  Court will not make ruling at this point.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Motion hearing on June 11, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Motion hearing on June 9, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant John Michael Rea in court with attorney Scott H Southworth.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Southworth notes Kansas needs to get governor's warrant.  Says he has spoken to deputy in Kansas and states what he learned from them.  Requests bond be altered to allow DE to travel to Kansas and his parents will take him down there.  State objects.  Court orders Atty Southworth to file formal motion re: this matter if that's what he wishes to do.  Bond continued.

14R 008082
Not to leave the State of WI

ADDRESS INFO for John Michael Rea
Current: 1601 Man Mound Rd., Baraboo, WI 53913 United States  (Effective: 04-04-2014)
Prior: 12285 S. Strang Line Road #1300, Olathe, KS 66062 United States
Return date on April 14, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Attorney Southworth.  Sue Mueller appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Fugitive complaint with the State of Kansas.  Attorney Southworth rec'd fugitive complaint.  Discussions re: bond.  State request hold without bond. Defendant waives reading of complaint.  $1500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  May not leave the State of WI.
